ygData.subject: MATLAB MEX file on Windows
ygData.msgSnippet: I have made a small modification to the Windows project files, so that when you build Cantera using Visual C++ .NET, and make an MSI installer, the MATLAB MEX

Subject: MATLAB MEX file on Windows
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=44728387; y=LG44lHciHpyVG-F8aWr1vFB30koxv1Qv4icN5dYp533o
X-Yahoo-Profile: dggoodwin

I have made a small modification to the Windows project files, so  
that when you build Cantera using Visual C++ .NET, and make an MSI  
installer, the MATLAB MEX file (ctmethods.dll or ctmethods.mexw32,  
depending on your version of MATLAB) will be installed in the MATLAB  
toolbox.  Currently, although using an older version of MATLAB will  
result in ctmethods.dll being correctly built, the installer does not  
copy it to the installation folder.

Note that a dummy file with the other extension is installed too,  
since there is no simple way to conditionally install files with  
different names using the Visual Studio Installer. You may need to  
delete this manually once you have run the MSI file and installed the  
MATLAB toolbox, but probably MATLAB will find the correct file.  The  
dummy file is the one that is smaller - it is a text file that  
contains the single line "delete me!".

If you have run the MSI installer that has only ctmethods.mex32, but  
you are using an older version of MATLAB, you may be able to use a  
MEX file I built with MATLAB 7 R 14: http://blue.caltech.edu/~dgg/ 
ctmethods.dll.  All you need to do is to save this file to the MATLAB 
\toolbox\cantera folder in the Cantera installation folder.

Dave
